children.value: Track custom events, page views, content/component views and identify visitors. Easily enable/disable channels and adapt event names and payload formats as you see fit.
Track custom events and page views
Auto track page views and element/component events
Queue system to avoid data loss with
Allows no vendor lock-in. Add and remove built-in analytics channels  (or your own!) as you need.
Use adapters to format standard event name and properties per channel.
component or directive to track seen and click events on any component.
Use analytics lifecycle hooks to take into and modify any event payload.
Use env configuration to enable/disable channels per environment.
Automatically track page view events with configurable channels and properties.

contents.title: Getting Started
contents.description: Tracking app events and analytics should be painless in Nuxt 3.

children.value: Tracking app events and analytics should be painless in Nuxt 3.
Add Nuxt Analytics to your Nuxt project

props.code: yarn add @moirei/nuxt-analytics
npm install @moirei/nuxt-analytics
pnpm add @moirei/nuxt-analytics

children.value: Automatic track page view on all pages
Optional properties to apply to every event
Event tracking methods can be accessed via composition API:

props.code:
const analytics = useAnalytics();

analytics.track("My Event");

children.value: It is recommended to type known events

props.code: identify(user, "ga");
page(props, "ga");

contents.title: Event channels
contents.description: Channels are the transports that send event data to your service providers.

children.value: Channels are the transports that send event data to your service providers.
By default all events are sent to all channels

props.code:
const { track } = useAnalytics();
track(AppEvent.Login);

children.value: To send event on specific channels, use
: Debug channel for development and testing
Simple channels can be defined inline in your Nuxt config:
By default all page views are tracked. This behaviour can be disabled the
If global tracking is disabled, it can be enabled per page by using the middleware
Only necessary is global tracking is enabled
Only page view events to select channels:
Send page view events to select channels with defined properties:
Sometimes we want to automatically track click and/or seen events on components. This is particularly the case for E-commerce search implementations.
events can be tracked on components:
can be used to further define renaming and formatting events per channel. See
directive, any element or component ascribed the
directive will automatically send events when seen or clicked.

props.code:
<product-card
  v-for="(product in products)"
  v-track-event="product"
  :key="product.id"
  :product="item"
/>

children.value: Further configuration can be provided via modifiers and/or directive value

props.code:
<product-card
  v-for="(product in products)"
  v-track-event.once="{
    data: product,
    clickAs?: 'Clicked Product',
    seenAs?: 'Seen Product',
    channel?: 'posthog', // OR ['posthog', 'ga', ...]
    observerInit?: {
      // IntersectionObserverInit options
    }
  }"
  :key="product.id"
  :product="item"
/>

children.value: This component uses the above directive to wrap around your component without modifying their HTML composition. It also provides a clearer (and typed) interface to the directive's configuration options.

props.code:
<track-event v-for="(product in products)" :key="product.id" once>
  <product-card :product="item" />
</track-event>

contents.title: Event adapters
contents.description: Adapters provide the flexibility to further define how Named Events are renamed and/or formatted per channel.

children.value: Adapters provide the flexibility to further define how
are renamed and/or formatted per channel.
for Mixpanel. With adapters, you define named events and then their names and payload properties are automatically formatted before sending to channels.
are supplied for common E-commerce events. You are free to extend or use your own adapters.
⚠️ When multiple adapters that map event name/property is detected, only one the first match is used.
This adapter will register a hook that formats event properties for your
model before any event is sent.
// Optional. Only apply to select channels

contents.title: Hooks
contents.description: Hooks can be used to tap into Nuxt Analytics lifecycle. A hook callback can modify event payload (globally) or signal the event to be completely discarded.

children.value: Hooks can be used to tap into Nuxt Analytics lifecycle. A hook callback can modify event payload (globally) or signal the event to be completely discarded.
Hooks can directly modify a payload or return a completely new payload data:
events are sent to a channel.
events are sent to a channel.
events are sent to a channel.
events are sent to a channel.
events are sent to a channel.
events are sent to a channel.

contents.title: Super properties
contents.description: Super properties are a way to define global properties to be associated with every event property. There are currently two ways to define super properties:

children.value: Super properties are a way to define global properties to be associated with
event property. There are currently two ways to define super properties:
At the module configuration level, and/or
At runtime via the composable or options API
💡 The example in this recipe inspired this module.

Tracking business metric events, with zero vendor lock-in, customised event naming per vendor, A/B testing, and all the goodness we love should not be a hassle. The below examples uses super properties, adapters, channel configs to
Include app info in every outgoing event,
Always send events to Google Analytics 4 and Facebook Pixel,
Send events to console log during development,
Send events to Posthog in production, and
Send events to Mixpanel in preview

contents.title: Search result events
contents.description: Another classic use case for Nuxt Analytics is tracking conversion or business value events on app components.

children.value: Another classic use case for Nuxt Analytics is tracking conversion or business value events on app components.
Take a simple search component as an example. Here we track when a visitor sees or clicks on a product that appeared in their search result.
can be used to further define event names and data format.
